page.title: 03UNDERGROUND SERVICES
page.content: Some services that enter our homes come through overland cables,but most pass underground e.g.Telephones, Sewage, Gas Water and Electricity. We found evidence of these services in the streets. We saw inspection covers for drains, gas pipes,stop-taps and hydrants which provide water for fire fighting. The water we use has to be cleaned. This is done by the Severn Trent Water Board which treats 2600 megalitres of sewage each day. First it enters a tank in which most of the large waste settles out. Next, the sludge is removed and methane gas is extracted and this can be used to generate electricty. The water is then cleaned in another tank by bacteria which feed on the waste. The clean water,now harmless to wildlife, is then pumped into a river.
